clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Ciforadenant in Combination With Daratumumab in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study of Ciforadenant in Combination With Daratumumab in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1b open-label study of ciforadenant, an oral, small molecule inhibitor targeting adenosine-2A receptors (A2AR), on safety/tolerability and efficacy in combination with daratumumab, a monoclonal antibody targeting CD38, in relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of ciforadenant in combination with daratumumab relapsed / refractory multiple myeloma.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of treatment, up to 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events, as assessed by NCI CTCAE v.5

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of ciforadenant in combination with daratumumab relapsed / refractory multiple myeloma.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days following first administration of ciforadnenat in combination with daratumumab
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) of CPI-444 in combination with daratumumab

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of treatment, up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: According to international myeloma working group guidelines (including stringent complete response [sCR], complete response [CR], very good partial response [VGPR], partial response [PR]).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of treatment, up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first assessment showing objective response to the date of documented disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of treatment, up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants achieving disease control for â‰¥ 3 months.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Time from end of treatment to starting next anti-myeloma therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants remaining progression free or surviving at a given time.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of treatment, up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of molecular minimal residual disease (MRD) negativity.

arm_group.description: Ciforadenant 100 mg orally twice daily in combination with daratumumab IV 16 mg/kg.

intervention.description: 100 mg orally twice daily for 28-day cycles
16 mg/kg administered intravenously as follows based on 28-day cycles: Cycles 1 - 2: Days 1, 8, 15, and 22 Cycles 3 - 6: Days 1 and 15 Cycles 7 - 24: Day 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Relapsed or refractory myeloma.
- Must have been exposed to at least 2 cycles of an IMiD containing regimen and PI containing regimen and must be refractory to at least one of the two.
- Must have completed and tolerated 2 cycles of daratumumab or other anti-CD38 targeting antibodies.
- Active myeloma requiring systemic treatment.
- Measurable disease per protocol.
- ECOG performance status of 0 - 2.
- Life expectancy of at least 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- POEMS syndrome; non-secretory myeloma (no measurable protein on sFLC assay); amyloidosis.
- History of select prior malignancies.
- Previous intolerance to daratumumab or any study drug.
- Received an allogeneic stem cell transplant within 12 months, or an autologous stem cell transplant within 6 months, or have ongoing toxicity related to transplant.
- Have an active infection or serious comorbid medical condition.
- Any live attenuated vaccination against infectious diseases (e.g., influenza, varicella) within 4 weeks of initiation of study treatment; uncontrolled human immunodeficiency virus, or positive tests for hepatitis B or hepatitis C.
- Female participants pregnant or breast-feeding.
- Screening chemistry and blood counts within protocol limits
- Treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medication within 2 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment or anticipation of need for systemic immunosuppressant medication during study treatment.

facility.name: The Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins
